name: Migrant Worker Rights Network
membership: MWRN is a member of Migrant Forum in Asia and the Migrant Working Group (Thailand)
memberOrga: MWRN has approximately 5000 registered migrant worker members
goal: The Migrant Workers Rights Network (MWRN) is a membership based organization for migrant workers from Myanmar residing and working mainly in Thailand. MWRN was founded on March 29, 2009 by a group of nine Myanmar migrant leaders who strongly believed that empowerment of migrants is the best way for migrants to protect themselves in their vulnerable situation as migrant workers in Thailand. The founders’ goal for MWRN is to promote and strengthen Myanmar migrant workers’ rights, eventually across the whole globe, by raising awareness, promoting access to justice and negotiating processes with employers and officials and advocating for policy change.
interests: Employment and Social Affairs, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Humanitarian Aid, Trade
euInitiatives: Working on improving transparency of supply chain data in Europe and US to facilitate greater ability to engage companies on supply chain abuses, particularly in Thailand and Myanmar. We have met with Cecilia Malmstrom as Trade Commissioner once on 6th Oct at the EU parliament in Brussels to discuss this issue and on 28th March will meet Head of her Cabinet, Mrs Maria Åsenius
